alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 31 at 3:48AM HST until February 01 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... .A northwest (310 to 320 degree) swell will produce advisory level surf through today for exposed north and west facing shores. The northwest swell heights will gradually diminish from Wednesday to Thursday. This High Surf Advisory was extended through Thursday for the west facing shores of the Big Island. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island today and tonight, decreasing to 6 to 8 feet on Thursday. * WHERE...Kona and Kohala. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
